intro: Palicourea palustris, commonly known as swamp palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with medicinal properties. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and small, clustered white flowers. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Palicourea palustris is often found in wetlands and moist forests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
